trustfund:
TF093304-AFGHANISTAN HRBF DESIGN - BANK EXECUTED,TF096362-ARTF Proposal for Strengthening
            Health Activities for the Rural Poor

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Strengthening Health
            Activities for the Rural Poor Project for Afghanistan were
            as follows: outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: public-private partnerships can be
            an effective mechanism for scaling up service delivery.
            Output-based lump-sum contracts, if supported by strong
            performance management, in general can be an appropriate
            tool for engaging non-governmental organizations (NGOs) in
            service provision. An important lesson for the Bank was
            drawn with regard to the procurement arrangements for
            contracting the service provider NGOs. Performance-based
            financing is a potentially effective mechanism to
            incentivize performance, and therefore NGO contracts should
            take advantage of it to a greater extent. Strong monitoring
            and evaluation is critical for achieving results. Strong
            institutional capacity is a key for sustainability.
